name: The Derwentwater Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010
reviews.text: Christmas break 2010.
reviews.title: Don't pay upfront

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I have just received an email from coast and country which is part of shearings holidays stating that after a terrible stay we endured in the hotel we will not be getting a refund for the day we did not stay.
reviews.title: winter holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: After enduring a cold stay in a hotel that had no or very little heating for 3 out of 4 days, a busted mattress, cold dining room and skimpy Christmas decorations, i would not recommend staying there. The hotel was so cold that other guests were leaving in fear of getting frostbite! This has truly ruined our Christmas and it will certainly be our last with shearings holidays.
reviews.title: Still a good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Please be advised if you do go, pay a deposit for the price of one night stay then pay for each night you stay after that, DO NOT PAY FOR THE FULL STAY BEFORE ARRIVAL.
reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Good luck!
reviews.title: Cosy, old fashioned room, very clean, food average, staff friendly.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: first the good bits....the setting of this hotel is stunning ,lawned gardens overlooked by a stylish and spacious conservatory. a walk from here takes you down to the lakeside through woodland and an SSSI abundant with wlidlife . ten out of ten so far !
reviews.title: disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: now the not so good ... Our room(204) rated as "superior" was nothing special and bizarrely had the bathroom in an odd position beside the window thus restricting the wonderful view and blocking the light from the rest of the room. I can only assume that there must have been a reason for this arrangement. As someone else said the general appearance on the upper floors is a little worn but it looks like the place is gradually being redecorated. Food, again nothing special, but very good value I guess.
reviews.title: Wonderful 4 day break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So overall a disappointing stay. It does seem to appeal more to older people...I would say while we were there most of the other guests were rather elderly which gave the place an odd atmosphere..... sorry to say that, but a range of ages would seem more pleasing.
reviews.title: A great short break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We came to Hotel for the first time and we absolutely loved it. The staff were wonderful, food great, excellent facilities and surrounding were great. We certainly will be coming back again.
reviews.title: great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel, now run by Shearings, is excellent in every respect.
reviews.title: In definite decline

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Took a 4 day inclusive package as did almost everyone else at the Hotel.
reviews.title: Great Location and Grounds, but Poor Standards.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The grounds to the Hotel are beautiful and the location is convenient - these are the best points. The hotel rooms are small, but clean and quite well fitted. However we found the double bed to be small and uncomfortable.
reviews.title: Magnificent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hotel gives the impression of being tired with peeling paintwork, decor, etc. The cleanliness in corridors and public areas was not of a good standard - in fact it was clear to see that the corridor outside our room was not cleaned at all during our stay. Restaurant floor especially edges could also have been cleaner.
reviews.title: Love this hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The overall standard of the food provided was poor - particularly two of the main courses which were close to inedible. Some meals were a bit better, but none were really good.
reviews.title: Standards have definitely slipped...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As is often the case Restaurant Staff were mostly East European and were all very friendly and helpful. The attitude of other staff was mostly good with a some exceptions. There did nopt seem to be any heirachy of supervision at the Hotel which could have raised standards. Most Staff appeared to be under 30 years whereas most guests were probably over 70.
reviews.title: Hotel deteriorating

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011
reviews.text: The room we were given was very poor standard,the shower had no pressure the bed was hard the pillows even harder and the carpet was filthy, although we would of had a very nice view if the windows were clean ! The food was bad and the staff rude and the manager was always "busy" or "away" we stayed 3 nights and had to order a chinese takeaway on the second night as the food was shocking in the restaurant and went into keswick on the third night after our "meal" to dine on real food. The area is fantastic well worth a visit just don't waste your money on this hotel.
reviews.title: Shocking service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is set in large gardens , leading onto Derwentwater and is ideal for local walks such as Catbells , or within short driving distance of the 3 peaks , Castkerigg stone circle , Cockermouth etc. We went on the 4 night all inclusive deal which was excellent . Breakfast was good English and dinner was very good every night . Service was generally very good , even though the hotel was completely full and they were short staffed one evening , we had no long waits and it was easy to make friends in the dining room . After dinner everyone went to stay in the lounge which , if you took the 8.00pm dinner sitting meant it was difficult to find a seat . Again it was easy to make friends in the relaxed atmosphere . On the Thursday evening , Norman Johns provided the entertainment and he was excellent . He tried to please the majority of the audience and succeded very well with his repertoire from each decade , varying from Elvis to Led Zeppelin . As the hotel was full , we were offered an upgrade to one of the vary large spacious apartments across the road but we rejected it to stay in a small cosy room in the main hotel . All in all a very good all inclusive break.
reviews.title: Lakeland wonderland , ideal for walking , talking ,wining and dining .

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Have stayed here many times but may consider B&B next time. I still adore the hotel but not so much the evening meal although it was better than it had been the last couple of years. Since the Shearings takeover, many things are not the same. But, you would expect that when a large company takes over a small and old fashioned independent hotel.
reviews.title: Still the perfect setting.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I miss the proper breakfast that we used to have with the delicious vegetarian croissant which has now gone to be replaced by a generic menu. The breakfast lacks mushrooms and fried bread but considering the health issues, meh, I can live without both.
reviews.title: Comfortable stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I still adore the place for it's comfort, for the views and the conservatory which has recently been very much upgraded.
reviews.title: Enjoyable Stay!

description: Take in the serenity of our grounds, and you’ll find pastures teeming with wildlife. Gaze across Derwentwater and you’ll find majestic fells, shrouded in time and mystery. Within the hotel, you’ll find an excellent standard of service, and all the facilities you’d expect from a Coast & Country venue. You’ll find an intimate, relaxed feel throughout, and a warm, friendly service at all times.
